entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs national electric utility deflects blame for power outages: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs national electric utility deflects blame for power outages: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç The owner of Armenia‚Äôs largest textile company was detained this week alongside a number of government officials as part of a corruption probe, Radio Azatutyun reported. üìç The chair of Armenia‚Äôs national electric utility repeatedly deflected blame for increasingly frequent power outages across Yerevan, as public anger continues to mount.

entry.title: Aliyev: Armenia and Azerbaijan agree on most of normalization points

media:group.media:title: Aliyev: Armenia and Azerbaijan agree on most of normalization points
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia and Azerbaijan have already agreed to the overwhelming majority of the text of a draft normalization deal, according to Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev. üìç Iran‚Äôs top diplomat said his country would not accept any threat to its neighbors‚Äô territorial integrity, in remarks widely seen as hitting back at Azerbaijan‚Äôs demand for a corridor through Armenia‚Äôs southernmost Syunik region. üìç Entrepreneur and Philanthropist Noubar Afeyan launched a new initiative aimed at building Armenia‚Äôs resiliency and prosperity. üìç Cultivating a collective growth mindset in Armenia with Chris Dedeyan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bx4fCUj16R0

entry.title: ‚ÄòReflections on a Life in the Russian and Imperial History‚Äô by Dominic Lieven

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄòReflections on a Life in the Russian and Imperial History‚Äô by Dominic Lieven
media:group.media:description:
Historian Dominic Lieven delivers a lecture titled ‚ÄúReflections on a Life in the Russian and Imperial History‚Äù at a symposium organized by the Monterey Initiative in Russian Studies at the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey. The lecture took place on July 5 in Yerevan.
Dominic Lieven is a distinguished British historian and professor specializing in Russian and international history. He is currently a senior research fellow at Trinity College, Cambridge, as well as a fellow of the British Academy. His research focuses on the Russian Empire, the Napoleonic Wars, and World War I. He has authored several notable books, including ‚ÄúRussia Against Napoleon‚Äù and "Towards the Flame: Empire, War and the End of Tsarist Russia."
This year‚Äôs Monterey Summer Symposium on Russia took place in Yerevan, Tbilisi, and Istanbul from July 1 to July 20.

entry.title: Armenia denies opening fire across border as fears grow of new Azerbaijani escalation

media:group.media:title: Armenia denies opening fire across border as fears grow of new Azerbaijani escalation
media:group.media:description:
üìç Russia‚Äôs ambassador to Armenia reiterated Moscow‚Äôs willingness to mediate talks with Azerbaijan. In addition, Ambassador Sergey Kopyrkin said he expects Armenia to resume full participation in the Collective Security Treaty Organization military alliance. üìç Yerevan continued to reject accusations by Baku claiming that Armenian forces opened fire last night and this morning at Azerbaijani positions across the border. üìç Insights with Eric Hacopian: https://youtu.be/uk6FOj3_9XY

media:group.media:description:

Eric provides his analysis on multiple foreign policy topics, ranging from the right of return of Karabakh refugees, as well as the fate of the prisoners in Baku, offering viewers a comprehensive understanding of Armenia's current geopolitical stance and future trajectory.

entry.title: Cultivating a collective growth mindset in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Cultivating a collective growth mindset in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the CivilNet Podcast, host Patrick Elliott is in conversation with Chris Dedeyan, a renowned peak performance coach and professional speaker. Together, they explore the critical mindset shifts necessary for Armenia's prosperity, delving into how collective thinking patterns can shape a nation's future. Dedeyan shares powerful insights on transforming limiting beliefs, cultivating a growth mindset, and harnessing the untapped potential within Armenian society.

media:group.media:title: Moscow expects Armenia to resume full participation in CSTO alliance
media:group.media:description:

entry.title: In Armenia‚Äôs Berkaber village, border delimitation with Azerbaijan sparks hopes for peace

media:group.media:title: In Armenia‚Äôs Berkaber village, border delimitation with Azerbaijan sparks hopes for peace
media:group.media:description:
The village of Berkaber lies on one side of the Joghaz reservoir, an artificial lake that forms part of the border between Armenia‚Äôs northeastern Tavush region and Azerbaijan‚Äôs northwestern Gazakh district. As part of a landmark border delimitation agreement reached in April, Armenian and Azerbaijani forces withdrew from some of their positions near the village in July. CivilNet traveled to Berkaber to find out what this all means for residents.
